tool_description: The API endpoint allows you to simulate a timeout or sleep for several purposes. By specifying the number of milliseconds (n) in the URL, you can control the duration of the timeout.
name: Timeout
title: Timeout

api_list.name: Milliseconds
api_list.description: The number of milliseconds{1-60000}, you can control the duration of the timeout.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://timeout1.p.rapidapi.com/timeout/100"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "timeout1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://timeout1.p.rapidapi.com/timeout/{milliseconds}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "timeout1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
